notes
property.value:
Introduction:
It is the year 1940. Germany has expanded eastward and is still on the offensive. All Axis nations are now at war with all Allied nations. All eyes are on Germany - What will their next move be?



Win Conditions:
Total Victory is obtained by an alliance controlling 15 of the 20 VCs at the end of a round.

Economic Victory is obtained by an alliance controlling 600 PUs at the end of a round.



Player Relations:

  • All Axis players are at war with all Allied players. This map features no diplomacy or possibility to change player relations.
    •
  • Neutral units can be attacked by both Axis and Allies.
    •
  • Pro-Axis-Neutral units can be attacked by Allies and moved through by Axis.
    •
  • Pro-Allied-Neutral units can be attacked by Axis and moved through by Allies.
    •


Rules and Setting:
This map uses 10-sided dice.

There are two alliances, 8 Axis vs. 12 Allied.

Order of play is as listed in the Economy and Stats tabs.

Some nations can financially support other nations, as long as these other nations have a Factory on the map.

USA, Iraq and Iran may support their major allies with fuel.

Battleships and Carriers have 2 Hitpoints and are repaired at start of player turns.

Canals are controlled by single territories marked with boom barriers.

Factories are destroyed upon capture.

Factories can only be placed on 5+ PU value territories.

Factories have a production capacity of 5 units.

Factories have 5 HP, can be strategically bombarded, damaged and lowered in production capacity.

It is possible to escort and intercept Bombers.

Air battles can only last two rounds.

Defending suicide units and munitions do not fire if attacked, but they may be taken as casualties. This is true for Kamikaze-Planes, Nuclear-Bombs, V1- and V2-Rockets.

Anti-Air and Cruisers have an extra special attack every round, with a 10 % hit chance, against aircraft.

Dive-Bombers have an extra special attack every round, with a 10 % hit chance, against land vehicles and surface ships.

Tank-Destroyers have an extra special attack every round, with a 10 % hit chance, against land vehicles.



Options and Requirements:
Recommended resolution: 1920 x 1080. (Because of the purchase screen size.)

Music can be turned off by unchecking: Game - Sound Options - Start of Your Turn Control.

This map is compatible with Fast and Hard AI, not Easy AI.


Resources:
PUs are used for all unit purchases. Territories worth 1-4 PUs have silver markers. Territories worth 5+ PUs have golden markers and are able to hold a Factory.

Allied Convoy Zones provide PUs for many Allied nations as long as they are under control.

Steel comes from iron deposits and is required to produce ships and land vehicles.

Fuel comes from oil deposits and is required to move ships and land vehicles.

Colonial recruitment potential comes from controlling specific territories and is used to purchase colonial infantry units. Several Allied nations plus Italy can make use of this resource.

SS recruitment potential comes from Axis controlling specific territories and is used to purchase SS infantry and tank units. All SS recruitment is done by Germany.

Kamikaze pilots are recruited by Japan in Japan, but this cannot be done before round 6 (year 1944).

Some resource deposits around the world are claimed by specific nations from game start. Friendly nations will automatically hand over these resources if captured from enemy forces.


Timeline and Events:
Early 1940 (Round 1) - Germany has just expanded eastward and is still on the offensive.

Late 1940 (Round 2) - Finland gains access to German technology.

Early 1941 (Round 3) - Balkan states gain access to German technology.

Late 1941 (Round 4) - China gains access to USA technology.

Early 1942 (Round 5) - Brazil gains access to USA technology.

Late 1942 (Round 6) - Several nations develop the Heavy-Tank.

Early 1943 (Round 7) - Several nations develop the Jet-Fighter.

Late 1943 (Round 8) - Germany develops the V1-Rocket.

Early 1944 (Round 9) - Japan can make use of Kamikaze-Planes.

Late 1944 (Round 10) - Germany develops the V2-Rocket.

Early 1945 (Round 11) - USA develops the Nuclear-Bomb.

Late 1945 (Round 12) - Germany develops the Nuclear-Bomb.

Early 1946 (Round 13) - USSR develops the Nuclear-Bomb.

Late 1946 (Round 14) - Japan develops the Nuclear-Bomb.

Early 1947 (Round 15) - Britain develops the Nuclear-Bomb.


Credits:
Map design and idea by Frostion. Thanks to all the developers, map makers and players of TripleA for any contributions. Special thanks to lead beta tester Black Elk for all his testing.
